context_analysis.email_summary: Katie responded about soil carbon paper - suggests SOIL or Geoderma journal after editing. Need to respond (15min task).
calendar_conflicts: Paige meeting at 8:00 will delay departure to ~8:30
context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 - good capacity for focused work. Planning 4:15 departure for gym, groceries, home by 6:15.
strategic_priorities: Finish and send Geoderma Review (top priority)
Start horizons run early for overnight processing
time_constraints: Need to start horizons immediately when home for overnight run

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Front-load high-priority Geoderma work before AI-LEAF meeting when energy is fresh. Use post-meeting momentum for MAOM-N edits. Schedule lighter tasks (email responses, echo backend) for afternoon when energy naturally dips. Start horizons immediately upon return home.
reasoning.energy_optimization: Leverage morning energy (7/10) for critical Geoderma review completion. Schedule 90-min MAOM-N editing block right after AI-LEAF meeting while still focused. Place 2-hour Ensemble writing in early afternoon when sustained concentration is possible. Save routine tasks for later.
reasoning.priority_sequencing: 1) Geoderma Review first (highest priority), 2) MAOM-N edits (substantial but defined task), 3) Ensemble MS writing (creative work needs good energy), 4) Quick Katie response, 5) Echo backend work, 6) Andrew email draft, 7) Horizons setup at home
reasoning.recovery_planning: Built-in recovery via AI-LEAF meeting (passive participation). Short transition blocks between major tasks. Gym at 4:30 provides physical reset. Evening kept light with just horizons setup and cooking. Full recovery after 7:30 dinner.

narrative.summary: I've structured your day to maximize that solid energy level of 7 while respecting your late start and early departure. Given that finishing the Geoderma Review is your top priority, I've placed it right at the beginning of your workday (8:30-10:00) when you'll be freshest after the Paige meeting. This gives you 90 focused minutes to complete and send it before the AI-LEAF call. After the meeting, you'll have good momentum to tackle the MAOM-N edits - I've allocated the full 90 minutes you requested from 11:00-12:30. The Ensemble methods writing fits perfectly in your early afternoon slot (12:45-2:45) when you'll still have sustained focus for creative work. I've distributed the remaining tasks strategically through the afternoon: Katie's quick response right after lunch, the echo backend work when you might appreciate something more technical and less writing-intensive, and Andrew's email draft as your final task before leaving. This sequencing respects both your energy patterns and the 4:15 departure time. Once home around 6:15, you can immediately start the horizons run to ensure it completes overnight, then focus on dinner prep for that 7:30 target. The evening stays relaxed as you wanted - just cooking and unwinding after a productive catch-up day.

questions.question: Would you prefer to draft Andrew's email earlier in the day when your writing energy is higher, or is late afternoon okay since it's for Francesca?
questions.context: Email drafting can be cognitively demanding - timing might affect quality

Evening kept light with just cooking and relaxation as requested
